author: pessimism
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell

Register-PackageSource -Name "nugetv2" -ProviderName NuGet -Location "http://www.nuget.org/api/v2/"

get-packagesource

Name                             ProviderName     IsTrusted  Location
----                             ------------     ---------  --------
nuget.org                        NuGet            False      https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
nugetv2                          NuGet            False      http://www.nuget.org/api/v2/
PSGallery                        PowerShellGet    False      https://www.powershellgallery.com/api/v2/

 Find-Package npgsql


```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.1> Find-Package npgsql
Name                           Version          Source           Summary
----                           -------          ------           -------
Npgsql                         3.2.6            nugetv2          Npgsql is the open source .NET data provider for PostgreSQL.


PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.1> find-package npgsql -source nugetv2

Name                           Version          Source           Summary
----                           -------          ------           -------
Npgsql                         3.2.6            nugetv2          Npgsql is the open source .NET data provider for PostgreSQL.

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.1> Find-Package npgsql
Find-Package : No match was found for the specified search criteria and package name 'npgsql'. Try Get-PackageSource to see all available registered package sources.
At line:1 char:1
+ Find-Package npgsql
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (Microsoft.Power...ets.FindPackage:FindPackage) [Find-Package], Exception
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : NoMatchFoundForCriteria,Microsoft.PowerShell.PackageManagement.Cmdlets.FindPackage

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.1> find-package npgsql -source nugetv2

Name                           Version          Source           Summary
----                           -------          ------           -------
Npgsql                         3.2.6            nugetv2          Npgsql is the open source .NET data provider for PostgreSQL.


```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.1> $psversiontable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 6.3.9600
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0


```

The documentation states that omitting the source parameter will search all sources.  This does not seem to be the case.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/packagemanagement/find-package?view=powershell-6

"Without specifying a package source, Find-Package searches through all installed package providers and their package sources for a specified package."

NOTE: This occurs with PowerShell 5.1 also on the same system.  I will file a separate issue for that.
https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell/suggestions/33201871-find-package-does-not-search-all-sources-if-sourc

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Find-Package does not search all sources if -Source is not specified
